Gallesia integrifolia (Spreng.) Harms and its synonymies Crateva gorarema Vell., Gallesia gorazema (Vell. Conc.) Moquin, Gallesia gorazema (Vell.) Moq., Gallesia ovata O. C. Schmidt, Gallesia scorododendrum Casar., Thouinia integrifolia Spreng. and G. integrifolia var. ovata (O.C. Schmidt) Nowicke belong to Phytolaccaceae family.
1 This tree is popularly known as pau d’alho (common name in Portuguese) and is native to Brazil, from the states of Ceará to Paraná. 2, 3 In popular medicine, the bark of this species is utilized to prepare teas for the flu, coughing, pneumonia, vermin, gonorrhea, prostate tumors and rheumatism.
4 However, despite the ethnopharmacological use, there are no studies on the chemical composition and antifungal activity of G. integrifolia fruit essential oil.
